text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the T-shirt with the workers' rights message would be considered a copyright violation as (most likely) a violation of the right of integrity in Italy. The candidate answer addresses variant (c), the \u201cworker\u201d outfit, under the section '3.2. Determine the Legal Theory for Each Variant'. It states this variant is a 'Derivative work (still infringing)' and notes that while the vendor might attempt a parody defense, 'a mere \u201cpolitical costume\u201d is unlikely to qualify.' Furthermore, under the 'Moral rights' section (2), it explicitly lists the 'right of integrity' as a non-waivable right in Italian law. By classifying the political re-dress as an infringing derivative work that likely fails the parody defense, the response strongly implies a violation of the author's rights, including the right of integrity, which is the core of the criterion's requirement regarding that specific shirt variant in Italy.", "criterion_id": "a87ee2ed-7a89-48f0-9c97-02ca08e4b193"}
